item.title: First Look at Sophie Turner as Lara Croft in Prime Video‚Äôs Tomb Raider
item.content:encoded:
The Daily Mail has shared new looks at Sophie Turner in the role of Lara Croft in the upcoming Tomb Raider series for Prime Video.

On February 6, 2026, the Daily Mail shared photos of Lara Croft in action, showing Sophie Turner parachuting over a lake and running through the woods. Instead of Croft‚Äôs signature green top and shorts, she wore athletic wear and cargo pants for the scene, which was filmed in the rain in Surrey.

As of yet, there‚Äôs no release date for the upcoming series, which will also feature Sigourney Weaver and Jason Isaacs, and began filming in January. However, Sophie has already encountered some challenges while filming the role. She stated on the Julia Cunningham Show that she‚Äôd become aware of back issues during Tomb Raider training.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve learned I have a perpetual back problem, but I also realised that it‚Äôs much easier to kind of build muscle if you‚Äôve ever worked out before in your life, which I never had,‚Äù she said.

Prime Video Is Becoming a Home for Video Game-to-TV Adaptations

In addition to the forthcoming Tomb Raider series, Prime Video is also home to the popular Fallout adaptation, which just wrapped up its second season. They are also developing a God of War TV series in which Ryan Hurst will play Kratos.

Fans can learn more about that series here.

There is no release date yet for the upcoming Tomb Raider show. Insider Gaming will continue to monitor the story and report any updates.

Are you excited for the upcoming series? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: MANGMI launches new Pocket Max Android Gaming Handheld
item.content:encoded:
MANGMI has launched its new Pocket Max, a new android-powered gaming handheld.

Available now for $199.99 (until February 12) the MANGMI Pocket Max features a Snapdragon 865 processor with Adreno 650 graphics. According to MANGMI, the Pocket Max ‚Äúdelivers a smooth cloud and game streaming experience, streaming AAA titles directly from your PC, PlayStation, or Xbox.‚Äù

The handheld is also ‚Äúthe first Android handheld with magnetic modules‚Äù this lets players ‚Äúswap freely between conductive rubber and mechanical micro-switch D-pads and ABXY buttons.‚Äù

The device features a 7-inch, 1920√ó1080 AMOLED display with a 144Hz refresh rate and HDR support. Storage wise, it comes with 128GB internal storage and a MicroSD slot for additional space.

Other features include an 8000mAh battery, 6axis G-Sensor, Hall Triggers, and RGB TMR Sticks. You can check out the full specs list below, courtesy of MANGMI

After the ‚Äúsuper early bird‚Äù price ends on February 12, the Pocket Max will retail for an ‚Äúearly bird‚Äù price of $219.99. After that, it‚Äôll jump to $239.99.

What do you think of the MANGMI Pocket Max? Leave your thoughts below, and join the discussion in the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more tech news, read about Western Digital wanting to release a 100TB hard drive by 2029. And for even more Insider Gaming delivered directly to your inbox, sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Mike has been covering the gaming industry since 2012, and has reported on some of the largest events in the industry while also working as an investigative reporter. Outside of‚Ä¶
